result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Nathaniel Joseph Lloyd appeared from jail.  Includes 15CF273, 17CF667, 17CF668 and 17TR5885. Case called at 3:18 pm. Court reviews file.   Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads  Guilty to Count #2 in 17CF668 without repeater enhancer. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 in 17CF668 without repeater enhancer. 15CF273 read in and didmissed. 17CF667 and Counts #1, #3 and #4 and 17TR5885 dismissed. Court orders PSI. km  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2018 at 09:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2018 at 09:30 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton, DF: Nathaniel Joseph Lloyd appeared. Court recalled.  Court proceeds with the arraignment.  State files the Information with the Court.  DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty.  Not Guilty plea is entered.  DE waives speedy trial.  Attorneys argue bond.  Court reserves on bond modification.  Set out for PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton, DF: Nathaniel Joseph Lloyd appeared.  Court called at 10:08 a.m.  Set for preliminary hearing.  DE waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver.  Court questions the DE.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Nathaniel Joseph Lloyd appeared from jail. Includes 15CF273 & 03FA90. Ms. Wolske would like some cash bond to remain due to non-appearance and failure to pay.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Defendant must post $500.00 to 03FA90 before release from jail.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
